comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0.1
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0.1

Download history is not displayed although files are normally successfully downloaded and accessible.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
Download a file through Firefox's built-in download manager or open Firefox's download manager through Firefox > Downloads.

Actual Results:  
Downloaded items and items being downloaded should be displayed.

Expected Results:  
Downloaded items and items being downloaded are not displayed.

I have installed Firefox 4.0.1 on a fresh install of Windows 7 Ultimate (64-bit). Formatting hard-disk and reinstalling Windows and Firefox, creating a new profile and testing on Firefox 5 beta (from http://portableapps.com) have not resolved the issue.

PS: I did not have the same issue when I upgraded from Firefox 3.6.x to Firefox 4 on a previous install of 64-bit Windows 7 Ultimate.

Below is a copy of about:buildconfig:
about:buildconfig
Source

Built from http://hg.mozilla.org/releases/mozilla-2.0/rev/fca718600ca0
Build platform
target
i686-pc-mingw32
Build tools
Compiler 	Version 	Compiler flags
d;D:\mozilla-build\msys\mozilla-build\python25\python2.5.exe -O e;D:\mozilla-build\msys\builds\moz2_slave\rel-2.0-w32-bld\build\build\cl.py cl 	14.00.50727.762 	-TC -nologo -W3 -Gy -Fdgenerated.pdb -DNDEBUG -DTRIMMED -Zi -Zi -UDEBUG -DNDEBUG -GL -wd4624 -wd4952 -O1
d;D:\mozilla-build\msys\mozilla-build\python25\python2.5.exe -O e;D:\mozilla-build\msys\builds\moz2_slave\rel-2.0-w32-bld\build\build\cl.py cl 	14.00.50727.762 	-GR- -TP -nologo -Zc:wchar_t- -W3 -Gy -Fdgenerated.pdb -wd4800 -DNDEBUG -DTRIMMED -Zi -Zi -UDEBUG -DNDEBUG -GL -wd4624 -wd4952 -O1
Configure arguments

--enable-application=browser --enable-update-channel=release --enable-update-packaging --enable-jemalloc --enable-tests --enable-official-branding
comments.author: desiradaniel2007@gmail.com

comments.author: xtc4uall@gmail.com
comments.text: Does setting browser.download.manager.scanWhenDone to "false" in about:config make a Difference?
comments.creator: xtc4uall@gmail.com
comments.raw_text: Does setting browser.download.manager.scanWhenDone to "false" in about:config make a Difference?
Just tried that. It does not.
comments.author: desiradaniel2007@gmail.com
comments.text: Just tried that. It does not.
comments.creator: desiradaniel2007@gmail.com
xtc4uall@gmail.com
comments.raw_text:
No Idea then. Haven't seen any Reports like this filed during/after Firefox 4 Development :-/

Maybe deleting "downloads.sqlite" and trying to repro again get us further?
comments.text:
No Idea then. Haven't seen any Reports like this filed during/after Firefox 4 Development :-/

comments.author: xtc4uall@gmail.com

comments.raw_text:
Sorry for this very late reply but I have forgotten about this thread. :( I am also having delays on testing since I encountered the issues on machines which I don't own.

Deleting "downloads.sqlite" does not solve the issues neither.

I also noticed the same issue on another machine running Windows 7 Ultimate 64-bit. It seems like 64-bit Windows or 64-bit Windows 7 users only are affected.

On the other machine, current downloads used to be displayed till they are complete and then disappear. My last download on that machine did not appear at all, probably due to corruption (The file was indeed corrupt.) I haven't tested further on this machine, although I did try clearing "downloads.sqlite" with no results.
comments.creator: desiradaniel2007@gmail.com
